title: Module 1: The Foundations
description: Understand the basic building blocks of Vedic Astrology.

lessons.title: Introduction to Vedic Astrology (Jyotish)
lessons.content: Vedic Astrology, or Jyotish (the Science of Light), is an ancient Indian system of astronomy and astrology. Unlike Western astrology which uses the Tropical Zodiac, Vedic Astrology uses the Sidereal Zodiac, which aligns with the current position of constellations. It is based on the Vedas, the oldest scriptures of India.

lessons.title: The 4 Purusharthas
lessons.content: Life in Vedic philosophy is guided by four aims: Dharma (Righteousness/Duty), Artha (Wealth/Resources), Kama (Desire/Pleasure), and Moksha (Liberation). Analyzing a horoscope helps understand the balance of these four aims in a person's life.

lessons.title: North vs South Indian Charts
lessons.content: There are two main styles of drawing charts. The South Indian chart is square, with fixed signs (Mesha is always second box from top left) and moving planets. The North Indian chart is diamond-shaped, with fixed houses (Ascendant is always top diamond) and moving signs.

lessons.title: The 9 Grahas
lessons.content: Vedic astrology uses 7 physical planets (Sun, Moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn) and 2 shadow planets (Rahu, Ketu). Each planet represents a specific energy or 'Karaka' in life.

lessons.title: Sun (Surya) & Moon (Chandra)
lessons.content: Sun represents the Soul (Atman), father, authority, and vitality. It is the King. Moon represents the Mind (Manas), mother, emotions, and comfort. It is the Queen.

lessons.title: Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn
lessons.content: Mars (soldier): Energy, logic, anger. Mercury (prince): Intellect, communication. Jupiter (guru): Wisdom, expansion. Venus (minister): Love, luxury, art. Saturn (servant): Discipline, delay, karma.

lessons.title: The 12 Signs
lessons.content: Aries (Mesha), Taurus (Vrishabha), Gemini (Mithuna), Cancer (Karka), Leo (Simha), Virgo (Kanya), Libra (Tula), Scorpio (Vrishchika), Sagittarius (Dhanu), Capricorn (Makara), Aquarius (Kumbha), Pisces (Meena).

lessons.title: Elements and Modalities
lessons.content: Signs are grouped by Element: Fire (Aries, Leo, Sag), Earth (Taurus, Virgo, Cap), Air (Gemini, Libra, Aqua), Water (Cancer, Scorpio, Pisces). And by Modality: Movable (Chara), Fixed (Sthira), Dual (Dwiswabhava).

lessons.title: Kendra Houses (1, 4, 7, 10)
lessons.content: These are the pillars of the chart. 1st: Self/Body. 4th: Home/Mother. 7th: Marriage/Business. 10th: Career/Public Status. Planets here are strong.

lessons.title: Trikona Houses (1, 5, 9)
lessons.content: The houses of luck and dharma. 1st: Self. 5th: Creativity/Children/Past Karma. 9th: Luck/Guru/Father/Higher Learning. These are the most auspicious houses.

lessons.title: Dusthana Houses (6, 8, 12)
lessons.content: The houses of suffering or transformation. 6th: Enemies/Debt/Disease. 8th: Death/Transformation/Occult. 12th: Loss/Liberation/Foreign Lands.
